channel.title: F5 Labs Learning Center
channel.description: RSS for F5 Labs Learning Center content.

item.title: What is Multi-Cloud and How Does It Affect Security?
item.description: A look at multi-cloud security strategies, including the emerging practices of omni-cloud, Functions as a Service, Containers as a Service, cloud security posture management, and data sovereignty.

item.title: What Is mTLS?
item.description: Mutual Transport Layer Security (mTLS) allows two parties to authenticate each other during the initial connection of an SSL/TLS handshake.

item.title: MITRE ATT&CK: What It Is, How it Works, Who Uses It and Why
item.description: MITRE ATT&amp;CK, a framework that uniquely describes cyberattacks from the attacker&rsquo;s perspective, is quickly being adopted by organizations worldwide as a tool for analyzing threats and improving security defenses.

item.title: Threats, Vulnerabilities, Exploits and Their Relationship to Risk
item.description: Security threats and vulnerabilities constitute risk when both likelihood and impact are high.

item.title: What Is the Principle of Least Privilege and Why is it Important?
item.description: Least privilege reduces risk to organizations by granting users only the privileges they need to do their jobs&mdash;and nothing more.

item.title: What Is Phishing? How to Recognize and Avoid It
item.description: &quot;What is phishing&quot; is still a relevant question we're answering as the attack type and techniques evolve, victimizing even the most tech-savvy users.

item.title: What Is Credential Stuffing?
item.description: Why credential stuffing attacks persists, how they work, and how to prevent them.

item.title: Digital Identity Is an Increasingly Popular Attack Vector for Cybercriminals
item.description: As cybercriminals continue trying to break into applications using legitimate channels, digital identity is a growing target. Learn what digital identity is and the attack methods fraudsters employ at every stage of the identity life cycle.

item.title: Securing APIs: 10 Ways to Keep Your Data and Infrastructure Safe
item.description: As organizations make more of their APIs publicly available, it&rsquo;s important they understand the potential risks of data exposure and establish best practices for securing all APIs.

item.title: Still Mystified by APIs? What They Are (Really) and Why They Matter
item.description: Understanding what APIs are, the role they play in modern apps, and the potential risks they pose to organizations.

item.title: How to Guard Against Identity Theft in Times of Increasing Online Fraud
item.description: In a climate of rampant online fraud, protecting yourself from identity theft requires taking some simple, proactive steps and remaining constantly vigilant.

item.title: Will gRPC Be the Next Protocol to Slip by Your Defenses?
item.description: Longstanding security challenges such as input validation, data exposure, and rate limits are affecting modern gRPC-based applications.

item.title: Fraudulent Unemployment Claims Signal Consumers to Step Up Personal Identity Protection
item.description: The three most effective steps you can take in under an hour to guard against identity theft.

item.title: Demystifying API Attacks Using Gamification
item.description: Learn about authentication, authorization, and security misconfiguration in API compromises by exploring this capture-the-flag game.

item.title: What Is Cross-Site Scripting?
item.description: Learn about cross-site scripting (XSS), how it works, and how to protect against it.

item.title: What Is SQL Injection?
item.description: Learn what SQL injection is, how attackers use it to access sensitive data, and how to protect your organization from these attacks.

item.title: What Are Security Controls?
item.description: An overview of the types of countermeasures security practitioners use to reduce risk.

item.title: Banking Trojans: A Reference Guide to the Malware Family Tree
item.description: Learn about banking trojans, how they work, and how the various malware families continually evolve to remain virulent.

item.title: What Is a DNS Amplification Attack?
item.description: Attackers use the Domain Name System (DNS) as a weapon against unsuspecting victims to bring down their websites.

item.title: What Is the CIA Triad?
item.description: Understanding the significance of the three foundational information security principles: confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

item.title: What Is a Distributed Denial-of-Service Attack?
item.description: Learn how DDoS attacks can cripple your network, website, or business.
